page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = ToOpenTable(SQLStatement as C, [Arguments as SQL::Arguments,] LocalTable as P [, Append = .t. as L [, EventScript = as C [, MapByPosition = .f. as L ]]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: TRUE (.T.) if the operation was successful; otherwise FALSE (.F.).

argument.name: SQLStatement
argument.description: The SQL query that selects the data to retrieve.

argument.name: Arguments
argument.description: Optional. A SQL::Arguments object. One or more arguments to be resolved when the SELECT statement is executed.

argument.name: LocalTable
argument.description: A pointer to an open Alpha Anywhere table.

page.description: Fetch data to an open .DBF table using a SQL query.
page.discussion: The ToOpenTable() method fetches results from a SQL database to an existing and open .DBF table. Columns in the query must match the type of the columns in the table. The query must not have more columns than the table. Note: The column types returned for each column by the query must match the respective column in the local table.

section.description: Because the args argument precedes the tbl argument, this example dims and passes it.
section.example: dim conn as SQL::Connection dim args as SQL::Arguments dim connString as C dim query as C dim tbl as P query = "select firstname, lastname from customer where lastname > 'm'" connString = "{A5API='Access', FileName='c:\program files\a5v8\mdbfiles\alphasports.mdb'}" if .not. conn.open(connString) then ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end end if tbl = table.open("customer") if .not. conn.ToOpenTable(query, args, tbl, .t.) then ui_msg_box("Error", conn.CallResult.text) end if conn.close()
